intro: Lepidium tianschanicum, commonly known as the Tian Shan cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in cold, high-altitude environments. Its small, white or yellow flowers are arranged in racemes, and it produces small, rounded seeds. Lepidium tianschanicum is valued for its potential medicinal properties and is also used in traditional herbal remedies.
